text: Among the interesting revelations today is that inmates may be relocated TO Rikers during construction of jails intended to replace Rikers. Story from @joeanuta and me: https://subscriber.politicopro.com/states/new-york/city-hall/story/2019/03/22/city-unveils-changes-to-plans-for-rikers-replacement-jails-ahead-of-public-review-930461 …

text: I just want to say I worked gender reveal party reference into a playbook post about the tweets over whether NYCHA would get a federal monitor and I was very pleased that I 1) knew the reference and 2) have never had to go to one.

text: have i seen town halls? it's like you never knew me.

text: There is consensus among the Politico NY City Hall bureau on the Rikers briefing: @MarcoACarrion is the lowest talker in City Hall. "I don't think those are words" a colleague said when I asked him to listen to my audio, after 10 tries of trying to ascertain complete quote.
author: SallyGold

text: Though saying @NYCMayor is late to game assumes he will change course on this. I suspect he will not. He feels adamantly about Israel, unlike things like closing Rikers, legalizing pot, fair fares where he dragged his feet out of concerns around implementation/law enforcement.
author: SallyGold

text: .@NYCMayor argues the progressive wing of the Democratic party should support Israel, esp given rise in anti-Semitism. Says he opposes BDS movement. He'll go to #AIPCO2019 this weekend.
author: SallyGold

text: .@BrianLehrer asking @NYCMayor about his plans to go to #AIPAC2019 "That should've been put on the public schedule even though it was very last minute" re: private gathering hosted by AIPAC last week. stories here: https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/albany/story/2019/03/15/de-blasio-attends-aipac-hosted-discussion-as-group-remains-flashpoint-for-liberal-democrats-916655 … and here:

text: "It seems like New Yorkers are not really interested in you running" @GloriaPazmino tells @NYCMayor. He replies, "Whatever decision i make w/ my family is based on what i think is the right thing to do."
author: SallyGold

text: .@NYCMayor "False false false. you can quote me @MKramerTV. Key word false" when asked about @LynnePattonHUD saying mayor is asleep at switch re: @NYCHA. He said she's not involved in chair selection talks & criticized Trump's budget for slashing capital funds for public housing.
author: SallyGold

text: .@NYCMayor - "I want to see a plan voted on April 1. There's a lot of ways to do it" re: fixing subways.
author: SallyGold

text: .@NYCMayor asked about rent freeze this year. "Any numerical decision is on the table" but said it will be data-based decision. Rent Guidelines Board under did rent freeze for 2 consecutive years under de Blasio.
author: SallyGold

text: This is a story about a public school and a publicly-paid employee in 2019. "It is the position of the Madison High School District that the inclusion of Adolf Hitler had no place in the context of an assembly intended to promote unity and character."
author: SallyGold

text: Important to remember that NYC's senior population is growing, and, as a result, the number of low-income seniors is growing too. Affordable housing lotteries can have wait lists that outlast the rest of these ppls' lives. We chronicled the issue in 2016: https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/city-hall/story/2016/02/the-senior-housing-crisis-031725 …
author: SallyGold

text: Knowing nothing else about this tweet I know exactly what you're talking about.
author: SallyGold

text: "All those positions are in the process of being filled," @NYCMayor tells @errollouis. Says he was surprised ppl didn't leave after 4 yrs-normal time to leave-and added "we're starting to fill them."
author: SallyGold

text: "He should be ashamed of himself for saying that" @NYCMayor says of @eric_ulrich using the phrase "poverty pimps."

text: The idea that one can *fully* understand what it's like to be working class without being working class is debatable at best. But if that pol represents policies that help ppl struggling financially, how much does personal wealth matter? https://politi.co/2JlHG4u  via @politico
author: SallyGold

text: Good line from @hollyotterbein & @MarcACaputo on @JoeBiden "For Biden and his supporters, “middle class” isn’t so much a financial status as it is a state of mind, a sensibility that’s ingrained in his political DNA." https://www.politico.com/story/2019/03/18/joe-biden-2020-money-wealth-1221934 …
author: SallyGold

(https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/17/nyregion/jobs-nyc-de-blasio.html …)
author: SallyGold

text: "The poll released Monday morning found voters across the state, 67% to 21%, believe the cancelled deal was a bad development for the state. Most voters, 61% to 30%, back the project, which would have linked $3 billion in tax credits to up to 25,000 jobs."
author: SallyGold

text: Vacancies are particularly noticeable in @NYCMayor housing agencies: in addn to @aliciaglen's former job being unfilled, mayor hasn't found anyone to take over @NYCHA. HPD has interim commish, and Rent Guidelines Board has some spots open.
author: SallyGold

text: One of the more confounding details of this is that Joe Esposito, whom @katie_honan reported was fired (perhaps w/out mayor's full knowledge) in November, is still OEM commissioner while @NYCMayor continues "ongoing search" to replace him:
author: SallyGold

text: By our count, @NYCMayor has 14 leadership vacancies including the deputy mayor for housing and 2 commissioners leaving soon- TLC and BIC. The ranks have thinned as city negotiates budget and legislative agenda in Albany. https://politi.co/2JkrUa3
author: SallyGold

text: .@RitchieTorres “Renewal Schools is failing to renew. ThriveNYC is failing to thrive and New York Works is failing to work."
author: SallyGold

text: I thought the deal @NYCMayor signed for @NYCHA w/ HUD and SDNY meant no criminal charges & prosecutors dropped complaint. But @LynnePattonHUD said on radio today the "criminal part" of the US Attorney's investigation "is not over."
author: SallyGold

text: .@GiniaNYT "It just so happens that in nearly every case, they have in mind a more suitable location for whatever the city is proposing than the place where they themselves happen to live." 2/2
author: SallyGold

text: .@GiniaNYT "Community activists who oppose development, almost always self-proclaimed progressives in NY, will consistently lead by telling you how committed they are to affordable housing, how important it is to mitigating social inequality and so on."1/2 https://www.nytimes.com/2019/03/15/nyregion/how-much-green-space-can-we-afford-during-a-housing-crisis.html …
author: SallyGold

text: I think you are entitled to define your status however you want. Some ppl say cancer-free, some say remission, some say survivor, some say thriver. The vocabulary around self-identification after a cancer diagnosis is really fraught and stressful. Just do you.
author: SallyGold

text: Pointing out AIPAC is controversial is not implying politicians shouldn't go to their conference. It's not a statement of judgment, rather of fact.
author: SallyGold

text: Thanks Josh!
author: SallyGold

text: It's hard to argue that supporting AIPAC isn't objectively, at the moment, a controversial stance.
author: SallyGold
